questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Sales. You are redesigning the main form.

Sales representatives for the company require a slider for a probability column where they enter a customer’s opportunity. The sales representatives want to avoid custom development.

You need to configure the form.

What should you do?

choices.B: Add a Power Apps component framework (PCF) control to the form.
choices.D: Change the column type to calculated.
choices.A: Embed a Power BI report in the form.

discussion.content: There is an out of the box PCF control for sliders if I'm not mistaken. So B.

comments.content: *A is correct as you can embed a power BI report to a form with no customization

discussion.content: I will stick to a given answer. A is correct as you can embed a power BI report to D365 with no customization

its B even tho they said no CUSTOM dev... this doesn't qualify as custom in MS eyes... even tho as soon as I see code I call it custom dev.. very misleading. its b tho https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/developer/component-framework/implementing-controls-using-typescript?tabs=before
.

comments.content: They want to avoid custom development...so PowerBI embedded will work. B

choices.B: personal view, and share it with the other representatives
choices.D: report that is sent to the team once a day

comments.content: how can you config.system view with sales reps.role? you need to be system admin

It never says that is the representative who needs to do the job of setting this up, it just says their requirements. Instead, it says "YOU need to setup the system", and you are not the representative... I would assume "you" are the system customiser.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I'd go for System View.
System view would be a correct option if it was organisation that they need to enforce it consistently throughout the user but since here it about an single representative it shuld be personal view

"Other sales representatives must be able to display the same information and format when necessary." says other sales reps not the entire ORG.... think about it.. would giving the whole org access to this data make sense? its B

Selected Answer: B
B is the answer
